galleries.description: Located at the Hôtel Salé in the Marais district, the Musée Picasso Paris is home to the world's largest collection of the famed artist's work. Its quality, scope, and diversity, make this comprehensive collection a unique voyage through Picasso's prolific career.
galleries.name: Musée Picasso Paris

galleries.description: The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo opened in 1952. The collection ranges from works of the Meiji era to contemporary art.
galleries.name: The National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo

galleries.description: Musée d'Orsay houses a premiere collection of French painting, sculpture, photography, and decorative arts from 1848 to 1915. Masterpieces include iconic works by Impressionists and Post-Impressionists, such as Monet, Manet, Degas, and Van Gogh.
galleries.name: Musée d'Orsay

galleries.description: SFMOMA is dedicated to making the art of our time a vital and meaningful part of public life. The museum has championed the most innovative and challenging art of its time, and we continue to exhibit and collect work by both modern masters and younger, emerging artists.
galleries.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA)

galleries.description: The Getty Research Institute, part of the J. Paul Getty Trust, is dedicated to furthering knowledge and advancing understanding of the visual arts. Its Research Library serves international scholars and the public.
galleries.name: Getty Research Institute

galleries.description: Home to the largest collection of Gustav Klimt’s paintings, the Belvedere in Vienna ranks among the world’s most striking and significant museums.
galleries.name: Belvedere Museum

galleries.description: The Blanton Museum of Art is one of the foremost university art museums in the country and is recognized for its modern and contemporary American and Latin American art, Italian Renaissance and Baroque paintings, and encyclopedic collection of prints and drawings.
galleries.name: Blanton Museum of Art

galleries.description: The Art Institute of Chicago is the second largest art museum in the USA housing a world-renowned encyclopedic collection.
galleries.name: Art Institute of Chicago

galleries.description: The Met presents over 5,000 years of art from around the world for everyone to experience and enjoy.
galleries.name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art
